page.title: 19A Village Divided-Ollerton
page.content: As has been indicated previously, {Ollerton/New Ollerton}is essentially the centre of this particular survey area.It is also one village of two diverse histories and characters. During the{miners' strike of 1984-5 the village was subject to activities which produced another kind of split. The majority of Nottinghamshire miners were not on strike,but the small ranks of Ollerton strikers were often supplemented by flying pickets from other parts of the country. This led to a massive police presence in an attempt to keep peace. However,police, pickets and working miners were involved in several violent clashes. The worst of these led to the death of a young Yorkshire miner. The dispute has led to a split between striking/working miners, which may take many years to heal,if ever.
